channel.title: Powers up fine with USB but not with DC
channel.description:
Topic says it all. Help needed, any ideas? I have two axolotis, one fresh out the box and it wont either power up with 9v dc plug :thinking:
EDIT:
I think I found the problem, Im pretty sure the dc plug is a little bit too short to hit the pins. I tried a little bit longer dc plug and it powers up axo fine.

item.title: Powers up fine with USB but not with DC
item.dc:creator: @Mindsetup
item.description:
@Mindsetup wrote:

Thanks, yea i had wrong kind of plug, got it working by changing the plug.

Read full topic
item.source: Powers up fine with USB but not with DC

item.title: Powers up fine with USB but not with DC
item.dc:creator: @Hohum_Gian Gianluca Simonelli
item.description:
@Hohum_Gian wrote:

Power supplies for guitar pedals usually have centre pin negative, cause there is a battery inside. Axoloti require centre pin positive. check it out

Read full topic
item.source: Powers up fine with USB but not with DC

item.title: Powers up fine with USB but not with DC
item.dc:creator: @Mindsetup
item.description:
@Mindsetup wrote:

The shorter plug works fine with guitar pedals, i wonder if I can modify it to work with axoloti. I already attached it to my system with glue

Edit: didnt help to cut the rubber to make the metal part longer, have to use the second plug then.

Read full topic
item.source: Powers up fine with USB but not with DC
